text.div:
Id: ANCDT01
Url: http://fhir.org/guides/who/anc-cds/PlanDefinition/ANCDT01
Version: 0.3.0
Identifier:

value: ANC.DT.01

Name: ANCDT01
Title: ANC.DT.01 Danger signs
Status: active
Experimental: false
Type:

system: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/plan-definition-type

code: eca-rule

Date: 2021-06-11T22:04:04-06:00
Publisher: World Health Organization (WHO)
Description: Before each contact, during the Quick Check, the health worker should check whether the woman has any of the danger signs listed here – if yes, she should be referred to the hospital urgently; if no, the normal contact should be continued as normal
Use Context:
codevaluedisplay
task ANC.B5 Quick check
Jurisdiction: 001
Libraries:
http://fhir.org/guides/who/anc-cds/Library/ANCDT01
Actions:
ANC.DT.01 Danger signs:
When: named-event: ANC.B5 Quick check
Then:
If no danger signs are present, the health worker can continue with the normal ANC contact
If: applicability: "Danger signs" = "No danger signs" (Should Proceed with ANC contact )
Bluish discolouration around the mucous membranes in the mouth, lips and tongue.
If: applicability: "Danger signs" = "Central cyanosis" (Should Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral for Central cyanosis)
This is a danger sign that indicates that the woman needs urgent management
If: applicability: ((((((((((("Danger signs" = "Bleeding vaginally") OR ("Danger signs" = "Convulsing")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Fever")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Severe headache")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Visual disturbance")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Imminent delivery")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Labour")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Looks very ill")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Severe vomiting")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Severe pain")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Severe abdominal pain")) OR ("Danger signs" = "Unconscious") (Should Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral)

name: ANCDT01
title: ANC.DT.01 Danger signs
description: Before each contact, during the Quick Check, the health worker should check whether the woman has any of the danger signs listed here – if yes, she should be referred to the hospital urgently; if no, the normal contact should be continued as normal

action.title: Proceed with ANC contact
action.textEquivalent: If no danger signs are present, the health worker can continue with the normal ANC contact

documentation.label: Pregnancy, childbirth, postpartum and newborn care guide (IMPAC) (2015) (1)

action.title: Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral for Central cyanosis
action.description: Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral for Central cyanosis
action.textEquivalent: Bluish discolouration around the mucous membranes in the mouth, lips and tongue.

documentation.label: Pregnancy, childbirth, postpartum and newborn care guide (IMPAC) (2015) (1)

expression.expression: Should Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral for Central cyanosis

action.title: Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral
action.description: Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral
action.textEquivalent: This is a danger sign that indicates that the woman needs urgent management

documentation.label: Pregnancy, childbirth, postpartum and newborn care guide (IMPAC) (2015) (1)

expression.description:
((((((((((("Danger signs" = "Bleeding vaginally")
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Convulsing"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Fever"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Severe headache"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Visual disturbance"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Imminent delivery"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Labour"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Looks very ill"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Severe vomiting"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Severe pain"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Severe abdominal pain"))
  OR ("Danger signs" = "Unconscious")
expression.expression: Should Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral
